title: Cheap build and makes coffee with a disgusting plastic taste.
body:
My new Dolce Gusto Genio S Plus arrived yesterday afternoon, and I have to admit at first glance it looked good.

However, after carefully cleaning the exterior of the machine I started to run water through it in order to ensure that it was clean and ready to use.

I have now run more than 20 tankfuls of water through this machine, including 2 bottles of descaler.

The water coming from the machine is still unuseable. The smell of plastic contamination is overpowering even after all the cleaning I have done. This makes any coffee produced by the machine undrinkable to say the least and quite disgusting.

My old machine has lasted for more than 10 years, and now as the motor seems to be getting tired I wanted to replace it.

The new machine is made of far inferior materials, cheap and very, very plasticy in the worst sense.

Because the machine is so poor and produces undrinkable coffee I will now have to purchase a completely different make which means I will no longer be using Dolce Gusto coffee from now on.

Selling poorly made and inferior machines is a grave mistake on the part of Dolce Gusto because not only have I returned the machine, but as a person who drinks only coffee, they have also entirely lost my custom as their coffee will no longer be of any use to me.

Unless you want to drink disgusting plastic tasting coffee avoid this machine at all costs!

If I could give this minus 5 stars I would.

title: Small or compact?
body:
Ok, its "small" (you can't fit a six inch tall latte glass under it} so you could take that as a negative, alternatively you could argue it is "compact" and treat that as a positive.
It is however fully automatic, the pods are easy to load, there are four temperature settings, an adjustable drink size dial and an expresso boost button if required.
The temperature settings are really useful and the highest hot selection really does produce a piping hot drink.
Reading negative reviews I have not found any real disadvantages other than the fact that six inch latte glasses don't fit.
"plasticky taste" - after following the "clean me first" instructions the machine then produced excellent tasting coffee, no problems,
"leaking water" - no, didn't experience any leaks either
"small capacity" - the plastic water tank, which is easy to fill, does hold 0.8 litres, enough for two decent sized cups of coffee with a bit to spare and yes, it would need topping up before re-use , but this takes us back to "small or "compact".
I upgraded from a lumio model to this one, which did take the larger glasses, but I found loading the pods a bit of a faff and the drinks were never really hot enough for my taste.
So, yes, four stars rather then five for the smaller glasses this model accepts , but the other features really outweigh this perceived shortfall.
Price wise, once again Amazon were very competitive and no issue with delivery.

title: Quite quick and easy to use
body:
The excitement on opening this box was quickly dashed when It was discovered that there were no sample pods included so I had to wait for my first cup of coffee. This is my first time with a coffee machine of this type and I found the quick start guide quite difficult to understand. I much prefer some written instructions and the guide did not adequately explain what the various lights and buttons were for and the options that were available. I had to download the manual from the website in order to realise that the bar indicator represented the volume of water that was produced and that it did not have to be what they said, it could be altered to taste. Also operating the volume control was not clear until I read the manual. Why this cannot be included in the box I don‚Äôt know.
My first cup of latte was half a mug following the guidelines given. There is an XL button to produce a larger cup of coffee but it was not clear how this should be used with a two pod drink. I did XL with the milk and finally had a decent sized cup of hot coffee. The taste was lovely, milky, frothy and not too strong. I added a sweetener as I like a sweeter taste. I also tend to run an XL size water only rinse through first to warm the mug up which keeps the drink hotter for longer. The cost of pods is about ¬£4 for a box of 16 pods which is 8 drinks for a two pod coffee which I prefer. This is slightly more than the sachets I normally use. The Dolce gusto website does have offers which can save a bit of money. I will say that their own brand are nicer than the Costa coffee pods.

Now I have got the instructions worked out the machine is quite quick and easy to use. It does make a noise which is about comparable with boiling a kettle. It doesn‚Äôt take up too much room on the work top. Price wise there are cheaper models available but this does have versatility in volume and temperature control which is useful.It is easy to clean but advises using the dolce gusto descaler every couple of months or so which is another expense.
I am also quite disappointed that non of my fairly standard size latte cups or glasses fit under the dispenser. There is an option to raise the cup stand for smaller cups so why they couldn‚Äôt test it with other glass sizes is another mystery.
